IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE RESIDENCES, OUTREACH PROGRAMS, AND TRANSPORTATION FOR THE DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHEASTERN MASSACHUSETTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE RESIDENCES, OUTREACH PROGRAMS, AND TRANSPORTATION FOR THE MENTALLY HANDICAPPED IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHEASTERN MASSACHUSETTS.
IRS990.Description: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES: RRI provides residential services for developmentally disabled individuals aged 18 and over, operating for the purpose of teaching independent skills in most areas of daily living throughout Massachusetts.

Activity2.Description: TRANSPORTATION SERVICES: RRI provides ambulatory and wheelchair transportation services to physically and mentally challenged adults to and from educational, vocational and on the job training sites throughout Massachusetts.

Activity3.Description: SUPPORT SERVICES: RRI provides supportive services to persons with developmental disabilities to include independent living skills for persons living independently, support to succeed in the workplace as well as day habilitation.

ActivityOther.Description: OTHER PROGRAMS INCLUDE OUTSIDE TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES, ACTIVE FUNDRAISING EFFORTS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE AND AFFILIATION WITH THE BLANCHARD MEANS FOUNDATION, INC., FORMED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING RECREATIONAL AND THERAPEUTIC SUPPORTS FOR DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED PERSONS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON AUTISM SUPPORTS.

OtherAssets.Description: BOND ISSUANCE COSTS, NET OF AMORTIZATION

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: IRS GAS REBATE: 10372. SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSE: 18390.
IRS GAS REBATE: 10372. SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSE: 18390.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: BLANCHARD MEANS FOUNDATION TRANSFERRED ALL OF ITS LAND, BUILDINGS, FIXTURES AND EQUIPMENT TO REHABILITATIVE RESOURCES, INC. IN EXCHANGE FOR FORGIVENESS OF INTERCOMPANY DEBT

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SUBCOMMITTEES OF RRI'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS AND ASSISTANCE TO THE GOVERNING BODY FOR FORMAL VOTE OF THE GOVERNING BODY ONLY ON BEHALF OF THE ORGANIZATION. SUBCOMMITTEES OF THE FULL BOARD DO NOT HAVE VOTING AUTHORITY TO ACT INDEPENDENTLY ON BEHALF OF THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 will be distributed to each director via email for review and contents will be detailed at a regularly scheduled meeting. The comments will be detailed by the CEO and a vote will be recorded to denote acceptance and to authorize formal filing of the document by Bollus Lynch, LLP.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WOULD BE BROUGHT TO THE BOARD'S ATTENTION PER POLICY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IN NOVEMBER OF EACH FISCAL YEAR AS SCHEDULED BY THE RRI BOARD OF DIRECTORS, CEO EVALUATION AND COMPENSATION REVIEW IS PROCESSED AS INITIATED BY THE RRI BOARD OF DIRECTORS. AGENCY WIDE STRATEGIC GOALS ARE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BY THE CEO FOR THIS PROCESS WHICH OUTLINES THE PRIOR YEAR'S ORGANIZATIONAL AND STRATEGIC GOAL SETS, OUTCOMES AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AS WELL AS DETAILING THE IDENTIFIED GOALS FOR THE FOLLOWING TWELVE MONTH PERIOD. THE PREVIOUS REVIEW'S GOALS FOR THE CEO ARE SUBMITTED WITH THE RESULTING OUTCOMES. IN TANDEM WITH THE CEO REVIEW PROCESS, THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER PREPARE AN ANALYSIS OF CEO COMPENSATION DISCLOSURES FOR A MINIMUM OF FIVE(5) NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS WITH CRITERIA OF LIKE ANNUAL REVENUE AND LIKE MISSION FOR COMPARISON. A FULL COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS IS PREPARED OUTLINING COMPENSATION AND BENEFIT PLAN CONTRIBUTIONS FOR A PERIOD OF THREE (3) YEARS FOR ALL ORGANIZATIONS SELECTED, TO INCLUDE RRI, UTILIZING FORM 990 DISCLOSURES AS PUBLISHED THROUGH GUIDE STAR AND THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL. THE RRI BOARD OF DIRECTORS, IN FORMAL EXECUTIVE SESSION, REVIEWS THE COMPARABILITY DATA PREPARED. COMPENSATION AND/OR BENEFIT INCREASES ARE APPROVED THROUGH FORMAL AND RECORDED VOTE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO IS THEN PROCESSED BY THE CFO AS AUTHORIZED AND DIRECTED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. REHABILITATIVE RESOURCES, INC. IS GOVERNED BY A VOLUNTEER BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHO DO NOT RECEIVE ANY FORM OF COMPENSATION. KEY EMPLOYEE AND UPPER MANAGEMENT COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE CEO. RRI PARTICIPATES IN ANNUAL NOT-FOR-PROFIT COMPENSATION SURVEYS THROUGH THE MASS COUNCIL OF HUMAN SERVICE PROVIDERS, THE ASSOCIATION FOR DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY PROVIDERS AND THROUGH ITS MEMBERSHIP WITH THE EMPLOYER'S ASSOCIATION OF NEW ENGLAND, INC. TO SET BASELINES AND COMPARABILITY OF SALARY FOR UPPER MANAGEMENT AND KEY PERSONNEL. SALARIES ARE DETERMINED AT POINT OF HIRE UTILIZING THE SURVEY TOOLS AS WELL AS EDUCATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT TO DETERMINE PREVAILING RATES, AND IN UNISON WITH THE FISCAL ABILITY OF THE ORGANIZATION. SALARIES ARE REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY THE CEO, CFO AND DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES AND CHANGES ARE MADE AS THE FISCAL POSITION AND FUNDING COMMITMENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION ALLOW.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Forms will be maintained at the administrative facility of the organization located at 1 Picker Road, Sturbridge, MA and therefore accessible for inspection as requested. Proper identification of reviewer will be documented upon request of inspection and as authorized by the CEO.

REHABILITATIVE RESOURCES, INC. HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COMMITTEE ALSO ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY OF THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.

SCHEDULE K- PART I - LINE A(f) DESCRIPTION OF PURPOSE BOND ISSUE A TAX-EXEMPT BOND ISSUED FOR THE PURPOSE OF REFINANCING A LOAN OF THE PROCEEDS OF THE MASSACHUSETTTS INDUSTRIAL FINANCE AGENCY'S REVENUE BOND, SOUTH CENTRAL REHABILITATIVE RESOURCES, INC. PROJECT - 1998 SERIES; THE REFINANCING OF CERTAIN TAXABLE LOANS TO THE ORGANIZATION, THE ACQUISITION, RENOVATION, FURNISHING AND EQUIPPING OF THE LAND AND FACILITY LOCATED AT 1 PICKER ROAD, STURBIDGE, MASSACHUSETTS, AND THE PAYMENT OF COSTS OF ISSUANCE. REFINANCING OF LOAN OF THE PROCEEDS OF: MIFA REVENUE BD, SCRRI PROJECT - 1998 SERIES: $1,524,173 REFINANCING OF CERTAIN TAXABLE LOANS TO ORGANIZATION: $914,937 ACQUISITION,RENOVATION,FURNISHING & EQUIPPING 1 PICKER RD FACILITY: $1,970,891 COST OF ISSUANCE OF BONDS: $90,000

SCHEDULE K- PART I - LINE B(F) - DESCRIPTION OF PURPOSE BOND ISSUE B TAX-EXEMPT BOND ISSUED FOR THE PURPOSE OF REHABILITATION OF A FACILITY OWNED BY THE BORROWER AT 1 PICKER ROAD, STURBRIDGE, MASSACHUSETTS; THE ACQUISITION OF FURNISHINGS, FIXTURES AND EQUIPMENT FOR THE FACILITY, THE REFINANCING OF EXISTING CONVENTIONALLY FINANCED DEBT ORIGINALLY USED FOR THE ACQUISITION OF LAND AND EXISTING FACILITIES, AND THE PAYMENT OF THE COSTS OF ISSUANCE. RENOVATION, FURNISHING AND EQUIPPING 1 PICKER RD FACILITY: $1,378,294 REFINANCING OF EXISTING CONVENTIONALLY FINANCED DEBT: $2,230,206 COSTS OF ISSUANCE OF THE BOND: $91,500

FORM 990-SCHEDULE R-TRANSACTIONS WITH RELATED ORGANIZATIONS-PT V-LINE 1R OTHER TRANSFER OF CASH OR PROPERTY FROM OTHER ORGANIZATION DURING 2009, REHABILITATIVE RESOURCES, INC. (RRI) AND THE BLANCHARD MEANS FOUNDATION (BMF)#04-3404698 ENTERED INTO A MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT WHEREBY RRI EFFECTIVELY ASSUMED CONTROL OF THE ORGANIZATION. EFFECTIVE MARCH 30, 2010, BMF TRANSFERRED ALL OF ITS ASSETS OTHER THAN CASH TO RRI IN EXCHANGE FOR FORGIVENESS OF THE INTERCOMPANY DEBT. THIS TRANSACTION WAS REFLECTED IN THIS RETURN AS A CONTRIBUTION OF $547,485 WHICH REPRESENTS THE RECORDED VALUE OF THE ASSETS OF BMF, LESS THE OUTSTANDING DEBT OWED TO RRI IN THE AMOUNT OF $171,282.
RRI BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE VOLUNTEERS. RRI DOES NOT HAVE EXCESS BENEFIT TRANSACTIONS.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: PROVIDE FACILITIES, PROGRAMS & SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS
